You are given a rooted binary tree. Each node is either a leaf node with a value or an internal node with two children.  

Two players take turns. On each turn, a player can choose two leaf nodes that share the same parent, remove them, and assign the value of one of the leaf nodes to their parent (which becomes a leaf node). The player chooses which value to assign.

The game ends when only one node (the root of the tree) remains.

Player 1 goes first and wants to maximize the value of the root node at the end of the game. Player 2 wants to minimize this value.

Assuming both players play optimally, what will be the value of the root node at the end of the game? 


You are given multiple test cases. For each test case, you will be given the structure of the tree and the values of the leaf nodes.  Output the value of the root node at the end of the game for each test case.

Two players take turns removing two leaf nodes from a tree that share a parent.  Each leaf node has a value. When removing the nodes, the parent node takes on the value of one of the removed nodes. The game ends when only one node (the root) remains. The first player wants to maximize the value of the root node, while the second player wants to minimize it. Assuming both players play optimally, what will be the value of the root node at the end of the game?
